pizzaProgram.database
Class DatabaseConnection

java.lang.Object
  pizzaProgram.database.DatabaseConnection

public class DatabaseConnection
extends Object

Class that handles the connection to the database. The URL username and password to the database is stored in the config/databaseinfo.cfg file. The class contains methods to check if there is an active connection, as well as methods to send queries to and receive ResultSets from the database.

Author:
IT1901 Group 3, Fall 2011

          A field that holds the connection to the database

          The file path to the database credentials config file
static int DEFAULT_TIMEOUT
          The default timeout period for database transactions, in case the connection is lost for any reason

          The maximum amount of allowed characters in a long VARCHAR column in the database

          The maximum amount of allowed characters in a short VARCHAR column in the database

Constructor Detail

DatabaseConnection

public DatabaseConnection()
Method Detail

connect

public static void connect()
Method that attempts to make a connection to the mySQL database that contains the data, based on info stored in the config/databaseinfo.cfg file.

disconnect

public static boolean disconnect()
Method that tries to disconnect from the database if there is a valid connection

Returns:
true if there was no valid connection, or the disconnection was successful; false if the method was unable to disconnect from the database.

isConnected

public static boolean isConnected(int timeoutInMilliseconds)
Method that checks if the the client is still connected to the database.

Parameters:
timeoutInMilliseconds - The time in milliseconds as an int to wait for an answer from the server
Returns:
true if the connection is still valid, false if not

fetchData

public static ResultSet fetchData(String query)
Method to fetch data from the the mySQL database using the provided query

Parameters:
query - a String containing the query that is to be sent to the database
Returns:
a ResultSet containing the result of the query

insertIntoDB

public static boolean insertIntoDB(String query)
Method to insert data into the mySQL database using the provided query

Parameters:
query - a String containing the query that is to be sent to the database
Returns:
true if the insertion was a success, false in all other cases

executeWriteQuery

public static boolean executeWriteQuery(String query)
                                 throws SQLException
Executes a write query like insertIntoDb(), but instead throws any errors such that they can be handled by any class that uses the function

Parameters:
query - The query to be executed by the database
Returns:
returns true if the query execution was a success, and false otherwise
Throws:
SQLException - Throws an SQLException if an error is raised during the execution of the query.

insertIntoDBAndReturnID

public static int insertIntoDBAndReturnID(String query)
                                   throws SQLException
Executes a write query in the database, and returns the row ID of the element inserted

Parameters:
query - The query to be executed in the database
Returns:
The ID of the last row inserted by the query
Throws:
SQLException - Throws an exception if an error is raised during the process
